Value.label: Input Type for Relay 1 (S1)
Value.Help: Choose the wall switch or input type you want to connect to the S1 C terminals. Default: 2 Press and hold the Z-Wave button for 5 seconds to change to garage mode manually. IMPORTANT: If you set this parameter to value 4-10, you’ll need to exclude and re-include the device (without changing any settings) so that a child device is created for the input of your choice!

Item.label: 1 – toggle switch (light on when the switch is toggled up,light off when the switch is toggled down)
2 – toggle switch (state changes whenever the switch is toggled)
3 – garage door (momentary mode for Z-Wave control)

Value.label: Input Type for Relay 2 (S2)

IMPORTANT: If you set this parameter to value 4-10, you’ll need to exclude and re-include the device (without changing any settings) so that a child device is created for the input of your choice!

Item.label: 1 – toggle switch (light on when the switch is toggled up,light off when the switch is toggled down)
2 – toggle switch (state changes whenever the switch is toggled)
3 – garage door (momentary mode for Z-Wave control)

Value.label: LED Indicator Control

Item.label: LED indicator is on when ALL of the relays are off
LED indicator is on when any of the relays is on

Value.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay 1
Value.Help: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 1 to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes, seconds, or hours (set the unit in Par. 15). Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535

Value.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay 1
Value.Help: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 1 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes, seconds, or hours (set the unit in Par. 16). Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535.

Value.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay 2
Value.Help: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 2 to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes, seconds, or hours (set the unit in Par. 17). Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535

Value.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay 2
Value.Help: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the device connected to Relay 2 to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes, seconds, or hours (set the unit in Par. 18). Values: 0 – timer disabled (default); 1 – 65535.

Value.label: Input Trigger for Relay 1
Value.Help: Choose if you’d like the connected input (switch) on S1 C / VC C to trigger the load connected to R1 or if you want to use the input reports for monitoring only and separate the output from the input. Values: 0 – input trigger disabled; 1 – input trigger enabled (default)

Value.label: Input Trigger for Relay 2
Value.Help: Choose if you’d like the connected input (switch) on S2 C / VC C to trigger the load connected to R2 or if you want to use the input reports for monitoring only and separate the output from the input. Values: 0 – input trigger disabled; 1 – input trigger enabled (default)

Value.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer Unit for Relay 1
Value.Help: Choose between seconds, minutes, and hours as the unit for the auto turn-off timer for Relay 1. Default: 0 - minutes

Value.label: Auto Turn-On Timer Unit for Relay 1
Value.Help: Choose between seconds, minutes, and hours as the unit for the auto turn-on timer for Relay 1. Default: 0 - minutes

Value.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer Unit for Relay 2
Value.Help: Choose between seconds, minutes, and hours as the unit for the auto turn-off timer for Relay 2. Default: 0 - minutes

Value.label: Auto Turn-On Timer Unit for Relay 2
Value.Help: Choose between seconds, minutes, and hours as the unit for the auto turn-on timer for Relay 2. Default: 0 - minutes

Value.label: DC Motor Mode
Value.Help: Sync R1 and R2 together to prevent them from being activated at the same time. Values: 0 – DC motor mode disabled (relays will activate whenever they're triggered); 1 – DC motor mode enabled (relay will check the status of the other relay after being triggered and will shut the other relay off before activating so that only one of the relays is on at the same time). Default: 0.
